title: Cross-price elasticity of demand -Good X and tacos

content.question: In relation to tacos, the cross-price elasticity of demand for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative. What would be the result if the price of tacos increases?

choices.label: There will be a movement up the demand curve for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because it is a complement to tacos.
There will be a movement down the demand curve for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because it is a complement to tacos.
The demand for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase because it is a substitute for tacos.
The demand for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because it is a complement to tacos.
The demand for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase because tacos and Good X are normal goods.

content.answer: The demand for Good <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because it is a complement to tacos.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
